授業目的:
Succeeding a family business poses unique challenges for managers, including managing unique value and culture for growth and prosperity, procuring external resources while maintaining control, and professionalizing organizational system without disrupting family bonds, just to name a few. The aim of this course is to familiarize those who plan to succeed their family businesses with some of the typical issues and challenges they are likely to face, and to prepare them for further study of more specialized subjects toward effective management of their family heritage. The course also introduces theories, concepts, and frameworks they may want to employ to examine their challenges in a theoretically rigorous manner. More specifically, the main objectives of this course are to:
1. Familiarize students with typical issues and challenges associated with management of family businesses.
2. Discuss approaches to address the issues and challenges by applying relevant theories, concepts, and frameworks.
3. Bridge foundational learning from core / basic courses and specialized topics discussed in advanced courses offered for business succession majors.
到達目標: Students grow so familiar with managerial practices employed by successful family business managers to overcome some of the typical issues and challenges associated with family businesses that they could prepare themselves for further learning of advanced course contents specialized for succession of family businesses.
授業方法: This course is conducted by a mixture of lectures and class discussions on selected family business cases. For each session, the lecturer introduces theories and concepts relevant to the case story, followed by active case discussion. Class discussions are focused on issues and challenges described in the case, as well as approaches employed to overcome these challenges. Students are expected to prepare for class discussions by reviewing case materials before the class.

第1回: Evaluating strategic alternatives available for growth of a small family business: As a part of an introductory discussion to the course, we will examine the issue of evaluating strategic alternatives available for the growth of a small family business. Unique opportunities and constrains associated with family-owned organizations will be introduced for further discussions in the following sessions.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第2回: Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第3回: Aligning strategic directions to the values of family business: One of the major challenges unique to the management of family businesses is to align its strategic directions to the values of family business. We will discuss the reason why it can be a major issue, and how one should address this challenge.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第4回: Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第5回: Balancing family-controlled ownership structure, its management philosophy, and its long-term viability: No manager of family-owned organizations fails to understand the importance to ensure effective control by the founding family. However, it is not always that straightforward to balance family-controlled ownership structure, its management philosophy, and its long-term viability of the business. We will discuss how these three may contradict, and how one should consider the solution.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第6回: Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第7回: Evolving family business organizational design, including structure, performance measures, and customer focus: The issues discussed above should be addressed by carefully evolving family business organizational design, including structure, performance measures, and customer focus. We will review topics on the organizational design, and then discuss how the general approach should be adjusted for the case of family-owned businesses.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第8回: Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第9回: Managing stakeholders, including suppliers and communities: Winning and maintaining strong supports from stakeholders, including shareholders, suppliers, and local communities, is also important to ensure sustainable development of family-owned businesses. We will discuss challenges and approaches to effectively manage productive relationships with stakeholders.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第10回: Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第11回: Dealing with family conflicts: No organizations can avoid internal conflicts, but effectively resolving internal conflicts can particularly be challenging when conflicts arise between family members. We will discuss this difficult issue in the context of transformation of a family business into a professional organization.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第12回: Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第13回: Valuing and harvesting a privately owned family business: Sustaining family business may not always be possible nor desirable. Accordingly, valuing and harvesting a privately owned family business should also be an important thought experiment for managers of a family business. The last session will be focused on challenges and approaches associated with this potential alternative.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第14回: Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
